messages.messageBody:
At 11:56 AM -0400 8/12/02, tinkiechelle1@... wrote:
>i feel the same way. i believe that everyone should have the right to say
>whatever you want and i have the right not to listen to it if i don't like
>it. isn't that what our country is about? and what fun would life be if no
>one ever stepped on anyones toes? sandra, ned and bob keep up the good work!

Ah, Tina, therein lies the crux of the problem... <g>

Helen

messages.messageBody:
i feel the same way. i believe that everyone should have the right to say
whatever you want and i have the right not to listen to it if i don't like
it. isn't that what our country is about? and what fun would life be if no
one ever stepped on anyones toes? sandra, ned and bob keep up the good work!
tina


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Newbie, chiming in...
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, Quick intro.  My name is Cherry.  My son is 3 1/2.  I ve been lurking almost a month now.  I hope that Sandra Dodd, Ned Vare and Bob (sorry can t remember
messages.messageBody:
Hi,

Quick intro. My name is Cherry. My son is 3 1/2. I've been lurking
almost a month now. I hope that Sandra Dodd, Ned Vare and Bob (sorry
can't remember your last name) all continue to post, whatever you
desire on this list. I don't always agree with any one of you, but I
see the value in all of your collective wisdom. I think you all
offer great point/counterpoint and plenty to discuss and think
about. And that is the point of this list right? Pardon me if this
is too much of a stretch but your styles remind me of the Malcolm X
vs. Martin Luther King discussions back in the day. Forward movement
through peaceful march and example or through the sword and the
hardline. I think both are necessary in this unbalanced world, so I
appreciate both of you.

Hi Beth :)

Going back to lurking now
Cherry
